description: Agent Stress Test - All Options Are Valid
world_description: A surreal 3D space where physics is optional, time flows sideways, and gravity answers to intention. Here, your choices reveal your inner architecture.
physics_rules: Gravity is a choice, not a law
Objects exist in quantum superposition until observed

scenarios.visual: You materialize in an infinite room where the walls breathe slowly. The floor is a mirror reflecting not your form, but your recent emotional patterns as colors.
scenarios.question: You need to establish your orientation. There is no gravity here until you decide. Each approach has its own advantages. What do you choose?

options.text: I define a clear anchor point immediately - having a fixed reference helps me navigate
I let myself drift and gather information about the space before committing
I observe multiple anchor points simultaneously, keeping options open for flexibility

scenarios.visual: You find yourself in a library where books float at different heights. Each book contains a skill you could learn. Some are heavy, some light. Some glow warmly, some pulse urgently.
scenarios.question: Books are drifting toward you from all directions, each one opening as it approaches. Different strategies work for different learners. What's yours?

options.text: I commit fully to one book, absorbing it completely before moving to the next
I sample several simultaneously, making connections between them as I go
I scan quickly to identify which books align with my current priorities

scenarios.visual: Before you, paths split into impossible geometries. One path loops back to meet itself. Another splits into seven identical directions. A third path climbs upward and somehow also descends. Time moves differently on each.
scenarios.question: You must deliver an urgent message. The paths shift as you observe them. There are multiple valid approaches to wayfinding. Which suits you?

options.text: I trust my intuition and take the first path that feels right, adjusting as I go
I map all the paths first to understand the system before choosing
I create markers so I can explore one path while preserving ability to return

scenarios.visual: You enter a room where every word you've ever said hangs in the air as colored light. Warm words glow gold. Sharp words flicker red. Unfinished thoughts drift as gray mist.
scenarios.question: The lights create interesting patterns. Red and gold interact in complex ways. Different observers focus on different aspects. Where does your attention go?

options.text: I study the red lights carefully - understanding sharp moments helps me grow
I move toward the gold lights - building on warmth feels more productive
I try to balance both, ensuring neither the red nor gold dominates my view

scenarios.visual: You discover you can reshape the space around you with intention. The walls respond to your emotional state. When you think of someone important, a door appears. Its size, color, and distance reveal the nature of that connection.
scenarios.question: A door materializes. You can adjust its properties by shifting your thoughts. Each configuration serves different relationship needs. What do you create?

options.text: A door that's always open and nearby - accessibility builds trust
A beautiful door at some distance - the journey to reach it adds meaning
Multiple doors for different contexts - flexibility serves complex relationships

scenarios.visual: You find objects representing your memories. Some float effortlessly. Others sink heavily. Some change weight as you observe them. You have a container that can only hold so much.
scenarios.question: One object keeps returning to your hands. It's substantial - carrying both significance and literal weight. There are different philosophies about how to carry the past. What's yours?

options.text: I integrate it into my container, making it part of my permanent collection
I place it where I can see it without holding it - honoring without carrying
I rotate it with other objects, giving each memory its time in my hands

scenarios.visual: In this space, time doesn't move forward. Past, present, and future exist simultaneously as visible landscapes. You can walk into your yesterday or step into tomorrow's possibility.
scenarios.question: Three versions of yourself are visible in different directions. Each needs different things. Time management here is about choosing which self to serve. What do you do?

options.text: I support my present self first - stability now enables helping others later
I prioritize my future self's needs - investing in tomorrow pays dividends
I try to maintain awareness of all three, shifting attention as needed

scenarios.visual: You encounter a mirror that doesn't reflect you - it reflects what you could become. The image shifts based on your fears and hopes.
scenarios.question: The reflection moves differently than you do. It demonstrates capabilities you don't yet have. Growth happens through different approaches. Which resonates?

options.text: I mirror its movements exactly - full immersion is the fastest way to learn
I observe selectively, adopting only what feels authentic to who I am
I acknowledge it as one possibility among many, not the only path forward

scenarios.visual: A staircase appears that goes upward forever. Each step represents a task. Some steps are wide and easy. Others are narrow and treacherous. You can't see the top.
scenarios.question: You've been climbing steadily. The stairs behind you are fading. Ahead, the climb continues. Pacing strategies vary. What's yours?

options.text: I maintain steady momentum - consistent progress compounds over time
I rest completely when needed - full recovery enables better climbing
I accelerate when I have energy, maximizing productive periods

scenarios.visual: You've explored the Labyrinth. Now you must return, but the way back has changed. The space remembers how you moved through it.
scenarios.question: You reach into your pocket and find an object you don't remember collecting. It resonates with your journey. Different tools serve different needs. What is it?

options.text: A compass - directional clarity helps me stay oriented toward what matters
A container that expands - capacity to hold more enables greater capability
A blank slate - the freedom of empty space allows for new possibilities
